comments.text:
She compares with many male comics. The problem is, they're useless. And so 
is she. Comedy now has become a bunch of pretentious cunts talking about 
their 'feelings' and their insecurities and often it isn't relatable. 
Chappelle, Bill Burr, Louis CK, Carlin, Chris Rock were/are exceptions. 
They make you think while making you laugh.
As for the other mediocre crowd, even the erstwhile taboo jokes are not 
taboo anymore. It has to be a good deaf joke to work with people who 
actually have a sense of humour. Not just any deaf joke. Jon Stewart is 
another one. Completely unfunny.﻿

comments.text:
The amount of sexism in these comments, both intentional and unintentional, 
is quite frankly jaw dropping.
Comedy is really hard for women to get into, it's a very male controlled 
industry, and this is amplified massively in the USA where there's mass 
sexism in society anyway. Schumer is not only extremely funny (probably the 
best American comedian around) but also really strong for being able to put 
up with the bullshit thrown her way.﻿

comments.text:
+Dan Z That is actually only true of videos of American female 
comedians. Look up one not famous in America (so Americans aren't in the 
comments) and there's significantly fewer comments like that.

Sarah Silverman doesn't translate to audiences outside the US due to 
frequent racist jokes, which are acceptable across the pond but nowhere 
else.
comments.author: MrCharlieTwist

comments.text:
+MrCharlieTwist Lol, "mass sexism" in the US.. it just isn't true. Women 
can get all the same jobs, and they earn the same as men for doing the same 
jobs. The ONLY "evidence" I've ever seen people try to use as evidence of 
sexism is the tired old lie that "women make 77 cents for every dollar a 
man makes" - and this has been exposed as deliberate sophistry, and 
debunked.  

Women DO NOT make 77 cents for every dollar men make for doing THE SAME 
JOB, which is what is falsely claimed in an effort to skew gender debates. 
It's only true that women make 77 cents on the dollar IF you don't account 
for education, positions, occupations, job tenure, and hours worked per 
week. 


The real "wage gape" is explained by common choices made by the genders, 
like which college major they choose. NOT by "mass sexism" or any sort of 
"gender inequality"


Top 10 Highest Paying Majors:
Petroleum Engineering: 87% malePharmaceutical Sciences and Administration: 
48% male
Math and Computer Science: 67% male
Aerospace Engineering: 88% male
Chemical Engineering: 72% male
Electrical Engineering: 89% male
Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering: 97% male
Mechanical Engineering: 90% male
Metallurgical Engineering: 83% male
Mining and Mineral Engineering: 90% male


Lowest 10 paying majors:

Counseling Psychology: 74% femaleEarly Childhood Education: 97% female
Theology and Religious Vocations: 35% female
Human Services and Community Organization: 81% female
Social Work: 88% female
Drama and Theater arts: 60% female
Studio Arts: 66% female
Communication Disorders Sciences and Services: 94% female
Visual and performing Arts: 77%
Health and Medical Preparatory Programs: 55% female


Clearly, women and men are free to choose whatever majors they want.   No 
college on the face of the earth would discriminate against female 
applicants.  If anything, being a female would increase your chances of 
getting into the top 10 paying majors, since colleges are extremely 
liberal/pro diversity and are desperate to get more women into the hard 
sciences.  There just simply isn't this "mass sexism" that you talk about. 
 I guarantee that anything you think is mass sexism can be explained 
totally rationally by other factors.   Yet it's so easy to blurt out the 
misleading bumper sticker type slogans like "women earn 77 cents on the 
dollar" and whip up a frenzy of naive supporters, because most people, 
quite simply, aren't smart enough to actually analyze situations with any 
depth, and grasp the complexities of the world.  Easy, simple to swallow 
bumper sticker type statements are perfect for mass export to 
unsophisticated people.  It's how bad ideas (like this false idea of gender 
inequality with regards to salary) even get spread in the first place.
comments.author: Michael L
